sense.name: an official event, competition, in which a prize is given
sense.examples: They have an annual pie-eating contest at the county fair. Sally's cousin has won several beauty contests in the Midwest. It was really no contest because the black stallion won the race by ten lengths. The knight challenged his rival to a contest for the hand of the princess. I have never known anyone who won a mail sweepstakes contest.

sense.name: an ongoing struggle for victory between rivals
sense.examples: He sees it as a contest between traditional and left-wing views. The congressional contests in the south are being closely watched. The theme of the novel centers around a contest between loyalty and honesty. The two brothers enjoyed a friendly contest of wits with each other.
